item.title: Elanor add a quote by J. R. R. Tolkien
item.description: "It seemed to him that he had stepped through a high window that looked on a vanished world. A light was upon it for which his language had no name. All that he saw was shapely, but the shapes seemed at once clear cut, as if they had been first conceived and drawn at the uncovering of his eyes, and ancient as if they had endured for ever. He saw no colour but those he knew, gold and white and blue and green, but they were fresh and poignant, as if he had at that moment first perceived them and made names for them new and wonderful. In winter here no heart could mourn for summer or for spring. No blemish or sickness or deformity could be seen in anything that grew upon the earth. On the land of Lorien there was no stain." -- J. R. R. Tolkien

item.title: Elanor add a quote by Thomas Hardy
item.description: "There was now a distinct manifestation of morning in the air, and presently the bleared white visage of a sunless winter day emerged like a dead-born child." -- Thomas Hardy

item.title: Elanor add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "I hate to advocate drugs, alcohol, violence, or insanity to anyone, but they've always worked for me." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Elanor add a quote by Thomas Hardy
item.description: "For the love of men like Fitzpiers is unquestionably of such quality as to bear division and transference. He had indeed once declared, though not to her, that on one occasion he had noticed himself to be possessed by five distinct infatuations at the same time. If this were true, his differed from the highest affection as the lower orders of the animal world differ from advanced organisms, partition causing not death but a multiplied existence." -- Thomas Hardy

item.title: Elanor add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Elanor add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Elanor add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Elanor add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I was with book, as a woman is with child." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Elanor add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "Poor bastard. Wait 'till he sees the bats. " -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Elanor add a quote by David Milch
item.description: "Pain or damage don't end the world. Or despair, or fucking beatings. The world ends when you're dead. Until then, you've got more punishment in store. Stand it like a man... and give some back." -- David Milch

item.title: Elanor add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Elanor add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Man only likes to count his troubles; he doesn't calculate his happiness." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Elanor add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Nothing has ever been more insupportable for a man and a human society than freedom. –The Grand Inquisitor" -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Elanor add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "I am a sick man... I am a spiteful man. I am an unpleasant man. I think my liver is diseased. However, I don't know beans about my disease, and I am not sure what is bothering me. I don't treat it and never have, though I respect medicine and doctors. Besides, I am extremely superstitious, let's say sufficiently so to respect medicine. (I am educated enough not to be superstitious, but I am.) No, I refuse to treat it out of spite. You probably will not understand that. Well, but I understand it. Of course I can't explain to you just whom I am annoying in this case by my spite. I am perfectly well aware that I cannot "get even" with the doctors by not consulting them. I know better than anyone that I thereby injure only myself and no one else. But still, if I don't treat it, its is out of spite. My liver is bad, well then-- let it get even worse!" -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Elanor add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "He was one of the numerous and varied legion of dullards, of half-animated abortions, conceited, half-educated coxcombs, who attach themselves to the idea most in fashion only to vulgarize it and who caricature every cause they serve, however sincerely." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Elanor add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "It’s not God that I don’t accept, Alyosha, only I most respectfully return him the ticket." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Elanor add a quote by Fyodor Dostoyevsky
item.description: "People speak sometimes about the "bestial" cruelty of man, but that is terribly unjust and offensive to beasts, no animal could ever be so cruel as a man, so artfully, so artistically cruel." -- Fyodor Dostoyevsky

item.title: Elanor add a quote by Anthony Trollope
item.description: "A small daily task, if it be really daily, will beat the labours of a spasmodic Hercules." -- Anthony Trollope

item.title: Elanor add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "She was a dull person, but a sensational invitation to make babies." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Elanor add a quote by Anthony Trollope
item.description: "Shall a man have nothing of his own; -- no sorrow in his heart, no care in his family, no thought in his breast so private and special to him, but that, if he happen to be a clergyman, the bishop may touch it with his thumb?' I am not the bishop's thumb,' said Mr. Thumble" -- Anthony Trollope

item.title: Elanor add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "Freedom is something that dies unless it's used." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Elanor add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I wonder do the gods know what it feels like to be a man." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Elanor add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "What is he to learn? To imitate? Or to avoid? When your friends the bees worry themselves about their sovereign, and become perfectly distracted touching the slightest monarchical movement, are we men to learn the greatness of Tuft-hunting, or the littleness of the Court Circular? I am not clear, Mr. Boffin, but that the hive may be satirical.' At all events, they work,' said Mr. Boffin. Ye-es,' returned Eugene, disparagingly, 'they work; but don't you think they overdo it?" -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Elanor add a quote by Fyodor Dostoyevsky
item.description: "The more stupid one is, the closer one is to reality. The more stupid one is, the clearer one is. Stupidity is brief and artless, while intelligence squirms and hides itself. Intelligence is unprincipled, but stupidity is honest and straightforward." -- Fyodor Dostoyevsky

item.title: Elanor add a quote by Anthony Trollope
item.description: "I hate a stupid man who can't talk to me, and I hate a clever man who talks me down. I don’t like a man who is too lazy to make any effort to shine; but I particularly dislike the man who is always striving for effect. I abominate a humble man, but yet I love to perceive that a man acknowledges the superiority of my sex, and youth and all that kind of thing. . . A man who would tell me that I am pretty, unless he is over seventy, ought to be kicked out of the room. But a man who can't show me that he thinks me so without saying a word about it, is a lout." -- Anthony Trollope

item.title: Elanor add a quote by Anthony Trollope
item.description: "He was one of those men who, as in youth they are never very young, so in age are they never very old." -- Anthony Trollope

item.title: Elanor add a quote by Anthony Trollope
item.description: "She became aware that she had thought the less of him because he had thought the more of her. She had worshipped this other man because he had assumed superiority and had told her that he was big enough to be her master. But now, -- now that it was all too late, -- the veil had fallen from her eyes. She could now see the difference between manliness and 'deportment." -- Anthony Trollope

item.title: Elanor add a quote by Anthony Trollope
item.description: "To feel that your hours are filled to overflowing, that you can barely steal minutes enough for sleep, that the welfare of many is entrusted to you, that the world looks on and approves, that some good is always being done to others -- above all things some good to your country; -- that is happiness." -- Anthony Trollope

item.title: Elanor add a quote by Anthony Trollope
item.description: "A man can love too.' 'No; -- hardly. He can admire, and he can like, and he can fondle and be fond. He can admire and approve, and perhaps worship. He can know of a woman that she is part of himself, the most sacred part, and therefore will protect her from the very winds. But all that will not make love. It does not come to a man that to be separated from a woman is to be dislocated from his very self. A man has but one centre, and that is himself. A woman has two. Though the second may never been seen by her, may live in the arms of another, may do all for that other that man can do for woman, -- still, still, though he be half the globe asunder from her, still he is to her the half of her existence. If she really love, there is, I fancy no end of it." -- Anthony Trollope

item.title: Elanor add a quote by Alan Moore
item.description: "There never was a Jack the Ripper. Mary Kelly was just an unusually determined suicide. Why don't we leave it there." -- Alan Moore
